page.title: 05NATURE AROUND LIVINGSTON
page.content: Our area has a large amount of greenbelt, farmland, deciduous and coniferous trees. The woodland next to {Selm Muir Wood}is dark and dense. It is part of{Lord Morton's}estate. Because of this natural habitat many wild animals can be seen in this area; roe deer, foxes, badgers, wild cats, rabbits and many small rodents. On and near the{Morton Reservoir}many species of ducks and gulls can be seen. Also many kestrels and owls are to be found in this area. The main streams which flow through our area are{Linhouse Water}and{Murieston {Water,}both being tributaries of the {River Almond.}They are full of life which constantly change with the seasons. These waters are extremely popular with local children for fishing and other recreational pursuits.
